name: Environaut\Export\Formatter\ShellSettingsWriter
short_desc: Writes all or specific groups of settings as SHELL variables to a file.
long_desc:
Supported parameters include:
- "location": Path and filename to write (defaults to 'environaut-config.sh').
- "groups": Array of group names. Only settings with those groups are written.
            By default all settings regardless of their group are written.
- "template": Content of file to write with placeholder '%settings$s' where
              settings will be put as shell variables (separated by newlines).
- "use_group_as_prefix": Defines if the group name of the setting should be
                         used as a prefix (defaults to false).
- "capitalize_names": Whether to convert variable names to all uppercase or
                      not (defaults to false).

format.name: format
format.short_desc: This method takes the given report and then does something with it.
format.long_desc:
This may include
writing the settings and messages to different files or send them somewhere.

It may return strings that will be output to the console afterwards. The return
messages may be formatted with tags understood by the Symfony Console Component.

report.name: report
report.short_desc: report to take results (and settings) from
